alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:29PM CDT until April 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. .River rises are expected to begin over the next few days on the Marsh River due to ongoing snowmelt. The rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to the rate of the ongoing snowmelt, and the potential for precipitation and colder temperatures in the forecast. The rise at this time is expected to be between 15 and 17 feet. Additional rises are likely due to backwater from the mainstem Red, although how high the additional crest will be is uncertain. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY, APRIL 21... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marsh River at Shelly. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Friday, April 21. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon to a crest of 16.0 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
